result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy M Peltier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled after 18 months

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages
No contact directly or indirectly with any National Exchange Bank & Trust 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription
Not possess financial documents for any person except her own

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent
Sign all releases
Contact with Nathan Huber allowed at his and the agents discretion

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy M Peltier
